chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 2 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with DTC court in case 22CF393.  Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 

NO VIOLENT contact with any family member.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

State files amended information. 
Defense accepts receipt of the amended information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. 

Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1 and 2.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1 and 2.
Court dismisses and reads in cases 22CF439 and 22CF516. 

Court orders the following:

WITHHELD
